item.title: What type of foam is best for packaging?
item.content: For delicate electronics, Anti-static EPE foam is recommended. For heavy machinery, high-density XLPE is more appropriate. Our specialists can help you calculate the exact G-factor requirements.

item.title: How long does custom production take?
item.content: Standard custom foam inserts typically take 5-7 business days for prototyping and 10-14 business days for full production runs after sample approval.

item.title: Do you offer international shipping?
item.content: Yes, we ship worldwide. Within the EU, shipping takes 2-4 days. For US or Asia, it typically takes 7-10 days via air freight.

item.title: Is your foam recyclable?
item.content: Yes, all our PE and PU foams are 100% recyclable through specialized industrial recycling programs. We also offer Bio-based foams for sustainable projects.

item.title: How to clean medical-grade foam?
item.content: Medical-grade foam can be sanitized with 70% isopropyl alcohol or standard hospital disinfectants. Avoid soaking the foam completely; surface wiping is recommended.

item.title: What are the differences between EPE and EVA?
item.content: EPE (Expanded Polyethylene) is softer and more flexible, ideal for shock absorption. EVA (Ethylene-Vinyl Acetate) is denser and more rigid, perfect for luxury presentation cases and tool organizers.

item.title: Can I get a physical sample before ordering?
item.content: Absolutely. We provide material swatches free of charge. Custom-cut prototypes can be produced for a small setup fee, which is credited toward your first full production order.
